title: Nifty: Weakness Seems To Prevail Amid Growing Volatility
text:
On analysis of the movements of and , in different time frames, I find that the Bank Nifty looks more precarious than Nifty 50; which may drag-down more bearish pressure on Nifty 50 till today’s closing. No doubt, weakness in China’s manufacturing activities may encourage Chinese Central Bank to come forward with more stimulating policy; but it reflects the growing outcome of tariff Sino-U.S. trade war tussle. No doubt that the fear of formal impeachment of U.S. President Donald Trump looks evident enough to keep all the trade deals in dilemma; which looks evident enough to enhance bearishness in global equity markets.

On one hand, on Friday U.S. consumer spending barely rose in August and business investment remained weak, suggesting the American economy was losing momentum as the trade dispute drags on. On the other hand, Industrial output in Japan and South Korea, released Monday morning, dropped more than expected, underscoring the headwinds from the trade war. Finally, I conclude that the investors are keeping a vigil eye over U.S. politics which takes a sudden twist any time; finally turns the direction of global equity indices. I find that the growing bearish impact of may push the more in negative territory. For watching my upcoming videos on Nifty 50 and Bank Nifty, subscribe to my YouTube channel “SS Analysis”
